description:
Chicken Katsu and Rice with a side of Macaroni Salad is so good. I have been walking by this place a lot, just haven't had a chance to try the food. But today I am glad I did.

I suddenly had a craving for chicken katsu and this is when I decided to come in.

After looking through the menu I went up to the counter and placed my order. I enjoyed my meal and I am so glad I didn't have need to go very far just for Hawaiian Cuisine. Just for this alone, I'll definitely come in again.

The side macaroni salad is delicious with the mayonnaise to give it a good flavor. I love the chicken katsu, breaded tender chicken meat that is crispy outside and tender inside. Two scoops perfectly steamed rice pairs well with these two items.

As fellow Yelp reviewer Sam stated, chicken katsu with macaroni salad is so good. Because it simply is and that is exactly what I had today.

Overall, good food, good service and friendly staff. Definitely worth the 5-10 minute wait for the food.

Just the quick FYI:
This place is cash only and if you are driving, good luck finding a parking spot.
author: Bennett W.

description:
There are many affordable dining spots along Asian-Friendly San Bruno Ave. If you are not a "Crazy Rich Asian" and have only $10.00 in cash in your wallet, then this is one of the dining spots for you.  

I am not sure if this Hawaiian Drive Inn is connected to the other locations. But this is one of the spacious and somewhat cleaner location than the others. 

 I have been here a couple of times earlier in the past Summer. I had the Chicken Katsu lunch plate. And another time I had the Teriyaki Chicken lunch plate. For $7.99 + tax, all lunch plates had the cooked meat, customary macaroni salad and steamed rice. Both chicken meats are very thin. And the batter from the Katsu is very thick and heavy, which I try to avoid at my age.  You get what you paid for. 

Just like the other businesses along San Bruno Ave, this is a "Cash Only" spot. The homie (owner), who works there, is very cool though. I try not to be harsh, but I don't give low ratings to my Asian peeps!
author: Matt G.

description:
I was craving some msubi , came here I order the spam and katsu msubi. Very reasonable for the price and the portion of it. But the taste it was very bland not flavorful and I had to add soy sauce for flavor. 

If I come back next time I would want to try the entree and see how it taste because I see alot of people ordering that there.
author: Hoa T.

description:
Check out their bbq short ribs so good #good service #nice price. The lunch menu the regular plate the barbecue short ribs with rice and macaroni salad it's a 5 stars. 
I recommend this place to my friends. 
You can order it and pick it up and it's ready for you to eat.
author: Lorie Anne B.

description: I ordered chicken wing and fries the chicken was over cooked and the fries weren't bad!! I would not recommend this place to anyone, the menus are out date and the atmosphere is not welcoming!!
author: Rasheed R.

description:
I'm not one to give out one-star reviews liberally. In fact, in almost 3,600 reviews, I've only given 19 of them before. Some gladly like the Westway Diner in Manhattan's Theater District where the glum waiter made up arbitrary rules about where we could sit by threatening not to serve us. Or at Lindy's where the waitress grabbed my arm on my way to the restroom to make sure I was paying the check. Sometimes it's just about the food and how inedible it is like the mix-it-yourself pho at the Asian Box in the Macy's basement.

Sadly, this is one of those situations. I have to admit this was not my first choice when I was in Portola, but this grubby corner spot was the most convenient before taking the bus back to my 'hood. Speaking of hoods, that appears to be most of their clientele, i.e., young boys in hoods (photo: http://bit.ly/2kKyQAj), probably not the most discriminating epicureans. The menu is Hawaiian fast food, and man, I had not had saimin in such a long time. I ordered the $5.50 Aloha Saimin. The noodles were limp, and the broth tasted rancid. Just look at it (photo: http://bit.ly/2kY3Qbu).

I guess I should have been thrilled that it had a slice of Spam and a slice of pork to go with the BBQ chicken and fried chicken. But it tasted like it was all left in the pot too long, and they were just trying to get rid of it. Knowing I wasn't about to finish it, I actually took a chance and ordered the $8.95 BBQ Short Rib Lunch Plate to go as if the saimin was somehow just a little misstep. Nope, the short ribs were overcooked and dry with the only saving grace the macaroni salad (photo: http://bit.ly/2l6zFjh). More boys in hoods kept gathering in the place. Time to go.

FOOD - 1.5 stars...saimin shouldn't be treated like that much less me
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...like a school cafeteria after a gang rumble
SERVICE - 1 star...non-existent
TOTAL - 1 star...substandard Hawaiian grub needs a major overhaul
author: Ed U.

description: This place is alright I guess it's like $10 per plate the portion of food is lame they don't give you enough lol...... the tables are sticky & the walls are dirty...
author: Lei S.

description:
I've visited a couple of times now and tried their spam musubi, hamburger and fries, and kalua pig so far. All were very inexpensive, and made rapidly. 

It's definitely not fine dining, and everything tends to be a little salty and fatty for me, but if you're craving hawaiian it'll satisfy and man is it cheap. 

PS. get a 'mini plate' as it's humongous.
author: El B.

description:
This is my go to for lunch if I don't cook. One regular plate is enough for two people, because they give huge portions. Not to mention, this place is relatively cheap about $9 for a plate compared to other places. I always get the chicken katsu. The rice can be a hit or miss, sometimes it's too hard and dry other times it's ok. I only order for take out.
The food is prepared relatively fast!
author: Angelina W.

description:
'Ho brah, Hawaiian Drive Inn cooked up some ohno grindz'

So I came in before the Sunday lunch crowd. There was a pair of boys playing a complex Asian fantasy card game in the corner, and two other patrons were waiting on their take out order.

I chose their daily special with chicken Katsu (pronounced cut-soo) and BBQ pork chop. I threw in a Spam Musubi for good measure. A short while later, the order came out. The spam Musubi had steaming rice, crisp seaweed wrapper and just enough fried spam to balance the salty hit with the plain rice. 

The bone-in pork chop was thin like a minute steak but had been marinated so it tasted like a tender teriyaki flavored jerky. Slightly sweet, slightly salty, perfect with the mayo macaroni salad, cabbage and rice. The rice was a bit mushy in parts which is what I expected having eaten some on the Big Island. The highlight however, was the panko crusted chicken Katsu! It was hot, crispy on the outside, but moist and tender within. I was thrilled that it wasn't greasy. They used real chicken breast pounded into cutlets. The sweet and sour sauce was a great dip. 'Shaka! 

The bathroom was tired, yes. And had graffiti on the walls, but at least it was clean this early in the day.

Eating here reminded me of some good times when I was a yachtsman after a long night of bar crawls--perfect place to silence the drunchies. I thanked the cashier in Cantonese and asked him if the Kalua Pork and Pork LauLau was good. He nodded earnestly and muttered that it was from Hawaii. Not sure what he meant, but I am determined to return and find out.

For a throwback to post college surfer grub, 'mahalo!
author: Lu-Shien T.

description: This place does not accept card! Only cash! That is pretty disappointing. Despite that, this place is good for lunch or if you're craving chicken katsu. I normally order a chicken katsu regular plate and I believe the portions are good. This place gives a lot of meat more than rice. The macaroni in the plate is also tasty.
author: Angelina G.

description:
Plus:
The portions are huge. If you order a mini, it's so much food.

Food is just okay.
Kulua pork is way too salty. Rice is overcooked slightly. Macraoni salad is bland (which is my favorite part of hawaiian food). 
Cash only. No delivery :( Can call in to pick up food though.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I came here for dinner and ordered chicken teriyaki plate with broccoli. The portions were large and the plate came with chicken, broccoli, rice, and macaroni salad. I was able to finish everything except the macaroni salad because by the time I got to it, I was pretty full.

The only thing that stood out for me was the portion sizes given the price. The food was...edible. The staff is very friendly and the restaurant has a pretty loyal set of returning customers (guessing from the owner interactions with the customers I saw).
author: Michael M.

description: I always order from here, they give big portions and the food is always good. The service is generally fast. And the guy in front is always very friendly!
author: Kellan M.

description:
I love this place! Portions are hugeee and they taste good IMO. This place is actually cheaper than most fast food joints! *though probably as bad in terms of nutritions :P*

I ordered the 2-item combo plate with BBQ short ribs and hamburger steak - along with spam musubi and portuguese sausage musubi. I opted to get 2 scoops of macaroni salad instead of 2 scoops of rice. The macaroni salad is delicious. They gave us gravy for the hamburger steak which I think is loco moco gravy. For the price I paid - I think the food was good.

An elderly couple runs this place - and they were really friendly. I appreciate good service anywhere. Just because we're not paying a lot for the food - doesn't mean that we don't deserve friendly services! :)
author: Priscillia I.

description: Low quality service and food, as well as an uninviting ambience. The short ribs we ordered barely had any meat on them, and the macaroni salad definitely tasted "off", like it had been  sitting out for way too long. It surprises me how bad someone can mess up something like the simplicity of Hawaiian plate lunch food
author: David T.

description: I called and ordered takeout. I ordered a bbq chicken plate, a chicken katsu plate, and a bbq chicken masubi; The total was $17.27. It took about 15 minutes for the food to be prepared. This place isn't like "OMG YOU HAVE TO TRY IT." The food is average, but they give pretty big portions. My plate came with a lot of chicken. Each place is served with two scoops of rice and macroni salad. If you're looking for something quick to eat, this is the place.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
Cheap prices are the only pluses I see here. Service is definitely lacking where the staff see's you more of a hindrance than a potential returning customer. Makes me sure feel like i'm not welcome and likely not to come back now. 

Ordered Loco Moco and substituted the rice with the macaroni mix. Brought the food home and reheated it just in case. Burger patties were dry and lacked real taste. The macaroni was excessively lathered in butter and I couldn't bear eating the whole thing without straining most of it out. 

After finishing the hamburger meat  I started to feel sick in my stomach. I feel all my energy sapped out of me and this lasted until the next morning. Lesson learned don't order hamburger meat here or the macaroni.
author: Jude N.

description: Really whole in the wall type of place. The Loco Moco and spam musubi is solid. However, the kahlua pork on the other hand. Do yourself a favor and don't order it. It's overly salty and horrible. It will make you regret your choice. Even Siracha couldn't make it better. There really isn't any service here as it's an order at the counter place. Everything is always packed as to go and they give you quite a bit of food.
author: Julie L.

description: Ok, when I walked in, it looked a litte jankie..but usually those type of places can be hidden gems. I'm eating the BBQ mixed plate, and so far I'm not a fan of the rice. otherwise everything else is decent. 3.5 is my true rating, but we'll round up to 4 stars.
author: Rob F.

description: First of all this place isn't in the Excelsior.  It's in Portola. And it's hella good.  Cheap and good quality, dunno how they do it but they do.
author: Desmond B.

description: This is another decent little hole in the wall on San Bruno, and a nice, cheap alternative to the three pho places in the same neighborhood. The menu is typical Hawaiian BBQ fare, somewhat modest in their overall breadth of offerings. If you're a big fan of L&L, you won't think much of this place, but it's not too far off in taste and quality. Down sides are: 1) like seemingly every other place on San Bruno, it's cash only; 2) it's definitely gritty in this place - food's not bad, but this place has been ridden hard and put away wet one too many times; 3) it's either a plus that they have a public bathroom, or a minus that you feel like you could catch a disease of all you did was just breathe in that bathroom. So...if you live close by, are too lazy to cook, and want decent, inexpensive grub, this place will get the job done. Just maybe take it to go. ;-)
author: Rod V.

description:
I order the chicken katsu plate. A minute later, Alan says "Okay!" from the counter and hands me the bag.

I get my food and sit down at a big table of wood formica under glass. A couple tables over, someone says "You can't have Star Wars without Jar Jar Binks."

The chicken katsu comes with two side dishes: white rice and macaroni salad, plus gravy. That's right, both side dishes are starch, one with mayonnaise. This is REAL Hawaiian food. Lili'uokalani wouldn't recognize it, but this is real American postwar middle-class Hawaiian food.

The Jar Jar guy says that only immigrants are ever successful in America. The person sitting across from him says that everyone born here is complacent due to the success of their parents, so they never make anything of themselves. They are both immigrants, somewhere around age 20. The Jar Jar guy says that unlike immigrants, people born here lack strong role models.

The Spam™ musubi is quite good! Much better than the katsu, I think. It's Spam™ on top of rice, wrapped in nori. A nice snack, surprisingly flavorful, only $1.80.

Now the Jar Jar guy (whose English is quite good) is saying that school wastes the best years of your life.

If you miss Hawaii, you must come here.
author: Ben K.

description:
Place to go for to-go food with reasonable price. Of course they have tables if you prefer to dine in. 

Came here with my brothers and i couple weeks ago for pre-dinner before the wedding reception since we knew the dinner course part will take a while to come out. Plus this place was close to the restaurant where the wedding reception

We order 3 mushubi and plate combo of chicken katsu, chicken teriyaki, and substitute one of the chicken with bbq short ribs. Mushubi had the right thickness of the rice where it didnt break apart when bite it. Right amount of flavor. I like that it wasnt too salty and too sweet. The plate combo was also good. Good portion of food for the price it was worth. Average flavor but it was good enough to eat

Luckily we came at the time when this place wasnt too busy so we were to get our food within 10 minutes.
author: Julie N.

description:
Chicken Katsu never disappoints. Macaroni salad + sriracha sauce is the BOMB.

Been coming here since my childhood and it still tastes just as good.

Small little place in the Portola, but if I had to spend $5 on food; this would be the place.
author: Sam K.

description:
Don't get me wrong, I love Hawaiian drive in l. I use to go to the high school only a few blocks away and this would be the spot to stop by and get a yummy meal.

The meals are reasonably priced, 5.50 for most mini plates, and 7.95 for the regular plate. I usually come to eat at the establishment, but this time I can't advise that you come in to eat. Better that you order to go if you live in the neighborhood and eat at home, or if you aren't from the neighborhood eat at one of the parks in this neighborhood. The reasoning is that for the past 8 years every time I eat there, the tables smell like onion. Today several table had soy sauce on it and the staff wasn't the friendliest. 

Get the food just don't eat at the establishment. I would have given a 4 or five star if it didn't continue to smell like a freaking onion. I'm all about supporting local businesses, but clean the place a little guys.
author: Ryan G.

description: Terrible quality no longer matches their once equally substandard prices. They've actually raised the prices on their plates, they've done nothing whatsoever to reflect the changes. The food tastes bland, the venue is rundown, the workers seem rundown...I learned my lesson. What once used to be bad quality, low priced, is now terrible quality, higher prices. NOT COMING BACK.
author: Kevin E.

description:
Lunch was $5 and damn was it good. For $5 you get BBQ chicken, rice and a macaroni salad. Healthy? No. Tasty? Hell yeah.

This location is bigger than the one near Balboa high on Mission. Conveniently located on San Bruno Av.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Inexpensive Hawaiian dishes for 5 dollars that can feed two people!  

Their BBQ Pork Ribs with one scoop of mac salad and rice is delicious!  They have other $5 specials, such as their Chicken Katsu.  I use their Sriracha hot sauce provided as a condiment on the dining tables as a way to spice up the taste and flavor!  

Definitely worth the bang for the 5 bucks!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I ordered for a mini plate and they didn't add any gravy plus they also put the boxed upside down.
author: Jefferey L.

description:
Chicken teriyaki and short rib combo is awesome
Macaroni is so delicious
$6.5 only- absolutely wonderful

Staff are very friendly too
author: Che K.

description:
Solid place to grab some food whenever I have no idea what I want to eat and it's during the awkward hours between lunch and dinner and what I prefer to call 'dunch'.

Most if their selections is standard to any other Hawaiian Drive In you've ever been to. Chicken Katsu, BBQ Shirt Ribs, Hamburger Steak and the ever so prevalent Loco Moco. All the mini and regular plate comes with cold macaroni salad which is little more than mayonnaise, macaroni and some carrots.

The Teriyaki Steak is really chewy and hard to rip apart and their plastic knife doesn't do anything to remedy this. The Chicken Katsu is a favorite of mine with enough meat to be really satisfying, but sometimes they can skimp on the meat.

Overall, this is a great place to grab a cheap bite of food for around five bucks.
author: George Z.

description: I have been coming here ever since it opened and I feel that the quality of the food has gone down a bit. My go to dish is the chicken katsu and this dish has been hit or miss for me. Sometimes it is really tasty other times I am left with a weird after taste. I have ordered the loco moco before as well a few times and I have never been satisfied with the dish. Every time I've ordered it, it tastes like the meat they used was left over old meat. The macaroni salad seems to lack flavor as well and spam musubis are mediocre. What is great about this place though is that your money goes a long way because of the large portions they give. The food here is not bad but not amazing. It is definitely a chicken katsu quick fix for me.
author: Brigitte M.

description:
AUTHENTIC HAWAIIAN BBQ!!!!

Their mac salad is soooooo good with sriracha sauce. Their BBQ pork, chicken katsu, spam masubi, mahi mahi, everything is delicious and is not badly portioned with the amount that you are paying.

Rice, mac salad, meat.... that's all a man can ask for.

Will always consider coming back.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
My previous review written over two years ago was pretty outdated and several of the facts no longer apply so being the responsible Yelper that I am here is my update ...

In the two years since my last review their prices have jumped about 55 cents per regular plate and 30 cents per mini plate.  It's still relatively cheap when you consider the mountain of meat that comes with your two scoops of rice and your scoop of macaroni, but like a true Chinese guy I've often gone "all rice" with my orders.  That rich macaroni salad can be nauseating sometimes.  I still eat here at least twice a month.

Some of the selections like their Bento with spam, mahi mahi and choice of teriyaki meat, their BBQ Mixed Plate or their Loco Moco come in a massive regular size only, but when it is offered I often just order a mini plate which gives you one less scoop of starch and slightly less meat.

Their fountain sodas are only available in a medium size now, and they've done away with the free refills asking for an additional 50 cents to refill your cup.  That could be a sign of the times too; although this place still gets super crowded around 2 to 4 PM with the after school kids and the late lunchers.  The service is good with most lunch plates ready in about five minutes even during their peak periods.  It's cash only, but there are numerous banks nearby along San Bruno Avenue so finding an ATM isn't too tough in the neighborhood.

I've posted some interior shots and one food shot of one of my favorites, the Lemon Chicken plate (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HBoimLjD4YBuY2pmwpQkWA?select=fOAqPd3MY1JtU1R44ax6mg) in the photos section.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Sometimes, you have a bad day.  The sort of day where you see the wave coming, a real sand-dragging horse of a wave, and you know that rather than trying to meet it head-on, you're better off swimming down under it.  You knew from the moment your alarm went off that you'd be better off sitting this day out.  Just holing up under the covers and trying again tomorrow.  But you've got a car to pay off, and the children need you, so up you get.  

So what do you do when it's the end of the long, bad, waste of a day?  You put on your sweatpants & get spam musubi at Hawaiian Drive Inn.  To me, this is the ultimate comfort food.  Trashy, yet edifying.  Good mix of starch & salt.  They make 'em big here - big & pretty.

Will the spam musubi cure your bad day?  Hell no.  But it'll lend a big, meaty shoulder to cry on.
author: Monica L.

description: Large portions and not expensive. I love the mac soooo much so I go all mac. Chicken katsu is great, the combo is good too. Warning: you will feel gross after eating a plate of this goodness
author: Liping H.

description: Food is decent. The chicken katsu mini plate always hits the spot when I'm starving. I always call for pickup and my food is usually ready within 10 minutes.
author: Agent K.

description:
Food was cold, tables were dirty, and the teriyaki beef was really poorly made. 
Don't think I'll be eating here again
author: Shaz L.

description: Great service and good food! Place looks a bit run down, but don't let that stop you from ordering..Portions are good enough for 2 people. My favorite is the garlic shrimp and the short ribs. Parking is a bit of a pain because is a busy commercial area. but I recommend
author: Claudia E.

description: The pork is amazing but it gets lost in the cabbage warfare for $9....I recommend the chicken katsu. It's $5.98 after tax and All that  and its on point after that 40 ounce bounce or that bleezy n heem.
author: Raymundo F.

description:
When it's starting to get late and all you want is something quick to eat, come here. I always get the cheeseburgers with fries and a soda here. This place is not spectacular, but if you just happened to be in the Portola area and you just want to grab some hand food, I recommend coming here. The prices are extremely cheap and the portions are pretty large for what you pay.
The staff is very nice and the location is convenient if you live in the area. 

I definitely dont recommend going out of your way to come here, but it's just nice if you are easily satisfied. 
The ambiance is very casual, your typical Hawaiian Drive Inn.
author: Veronica L.

description:
MASUBI SPAM!!!

My ultimate fave and addiction when walking into any Hawaiian Drive-Inn. Thick slice of spam wrapped in between a massive load of rice and seaweed and their special sauce. Great for those on the go snack..
author: Anonymous P.

description:
I tried a Hawaiian Drive Inn in Oahu, HI when I visited because I wanted short ribs, but i remember it tasting gross and never wanted to go to these chains anymore.  

I ordered the combo plate with BBQ short ribs , garlic shrimp and all Mac for $9. I dislike rice, but this was the first time I wish I ordered some rice. They were really generous with the Mac, except it felt like I was eating spoonful of mayo. The shrimp was too salty and tasted really old and dry. Short ribs were good, but it could have been cooked alittle longer to get the bbq crisp taste to it. Also ordered a large frie and that was worth my $2,  

Don't think I will be back. Meh, I've experienced better!
author: Chanel L.

description: Soooo.... This is the second restaurant that has done this. I called 15 minutes ago for an order to be picked up. I have two sons and a hungry husband so I wanted to make dinner as smooth as possible. When I came to pick up my order it hadn't even been started. It's frustrating when you plan ahead but end up still waiting for your order.
author: Joann V.

description: Really good food!!! Large portions and the Staff is friendly! And it's very affordable!
author: Lorenzo K.

description: Review for their Musubi ONLY. So I came to this particular Hawaiian Drive Inn for a Chicken Katsu Musubi well not the best I have ever ate there was not enough sauce and it tastes a little too plain with no flavor. I would suggest the Hawaiian Drive Inn at Mission and Onondaga it tastes so much better and cheaper. I would say this location is pretty clean so that is a plus I might give it another try.
author: Peter C.

description: I used to go here because it is right up the street from my house, and it was the least sketchiest place on this street. But it isn't all that great. I would just go here because its was the place to go if you're lazy. If I didn't live nearby, I wouldn't go. And that picture of a bug in the rice just grossed me out and I probably will never go back. Ew!
author: Jamie B.

description:
The only good thing I can say is it's really really cheap. But they fill your plate with white rice and greasy macaroni salad so it's not even that much of a deal (you can make rice & macaroni much cheaper at home).

The worst part about this place is they only use plastic & styrofoam to serve food, even if you eat at a table. So not only are they breaking San Francisco law, but they're causing MOUNTAINS of trash and even putting you at higher risk for cancer (see http://www.sfenvironment.org/article/prevent-waste/food-service-waste-reduction-ordinance ).

Plus, they don't even have a recycling can in the restaurant for all the plastic they're serving, so that gets trashed too.
author: Geae D.

description: I like the food but people that work there are not very friendly, actually they are rude!and dont seem to want to learn or teach good customer service skills! Major downfall thhere is no no no appreciation!!!!Thats a no no in my book! cash only sucks too!
author: Susie C.

description:
Pretty much your typical Hawaiian BBQ food with a bit of chinese food mixed in. I ordered here a bunch of times and it usually does the job. It gets me filled up without tasting like complete crap, but its no gourmet food either. 

I ordered the Beef Curry this time and expected BBQ beef with curry sauce over it for some reason but it was just cubes of beef, potatoes and carrots in curry sauce. It wasn't too bad, but it wasn't anything to brag about either. It's cheap, fast and decent tasting so I'm not really complaining. Would prefer to eat an Ono Hawaiian BBQ over this but it's so far so this is what I'll be settling for whenever I crave for hawaiian food. 

Service is decent, the cashier takes your order and your order will be out in about 5-10 minutes. 

***Parking***: May be a bit hard to find since its located in the busy street of San Bruno Ave. You might have to drive around a couple blocks to find parking.

Cash ONLY!
author: Johnny G.

description: The bbq mix plate is good. This is one of those places where the flavor is the same u cant go wrong... prices are reasonable and it keeps you full for a while. I do remonwnd this place if you never been
author: Rigoberto C.

description: Cash only?! In San Francisco?? You can swipe a credit card with your phone... come on!! If you don't have cash, don't even waste your time going to an ATM to buy their food. It's not worth it. Walk down the street to one of the other 15 restaurants within 4 blocks and be happy with this decision.
author: Chase L.

description: I come here whenever there isn't much food at home or when my dad and I need to make a quick stop to eat something. I usually place my order over the phone so when I get there i can just pay. However there have been times where I order on the phone and until I get there they start to make my food. The place is pretty neat and the food is good, especially the chicken katsu. I always choose to get the smaller version of chicken katsu because the normal sized is too big for me to eat it all. Overall it's a pretty good place.
author: Mellany Q.

description: Very very good Hawaiian BBQ. Good deal for the amount if food you get. The people working are very nice. Cash only though. Bring your bills and your appetite.
author: Natalie V.

description: I liked the taste of the food. It was good! The only thing that made me feel uncomfortable was that they allowed a dog to enter into the restaurant. I think that's kind of gross. Wished the cashier told the man to walk the dog outside but it seemed like he was ok with it. Idk if this is allowed by the health department or to what extent is it allowed. Don't think I'll go back.
author: Bianca H.

description:
It's Hawaiian drive inn. Nothing spectacular. For those of you who don't know you can order non-cooked pre-marinated  chicken teriyaki strips for parties.

Honestly, I'd rather have L&L Hawaiian BBQ for their poke (fresh tuna), but if I want fresh tuna I might as well just have Japanese food.
author: Jimmy W.

description: The cashier that was rude to my friend wasn't there, it was a guy and he was very polite. he got my order right and gave me the right change. I ordered a lemon chicken and Spam musubi. the lemon chicken was good but the spam musubi had too much rice and very little teriyaki sauce. Overall my experience here is a lot better than last time. I would definitely come back.
author: Linda A.

description:
This is a hole-in-the-wall place located in South San Francisco (borders north San Bruno) near the Tanforan Mall. I will make this short and sweet: Do not eat here if you do not like large portions of food. My father was born and raised on Oahu, and I basically grew up eating a combination of Japanese and Hawaiian food. 

I came here shortly after work after skipping lunch to attend a string of meetings. I was hungry enough to eat a side of beef at this point, and I was worried that my food decision would result in small portions. The aftermath would not be pretty. There is no decor here. There are a few small tables in a very small setting. 

I briefly scanned the limited menu, and chose both the loco moco and an order of spam musubi. When my loco moco arrived, they couldn't close the strofoam container because there was too much food. I was in trouble. My goal for this meal was to leave with no left-overs. When my spam musubi finally came, I had before, an enormous challenge, however I finished EVERYTHING. The gravy wasn't overly salty, and the burger patties weren't overcooked (things you typically run into when you faced with sub-par loco moco). I ate so fast that I really didn't get a chance to savor the food, however I gave my review 4 stars for the sheer volume they served me.
author: Eric Y.

description:
I enjoy this place because it adds a variety to the neighborhood. It's a shame the place before this was a sushi restaurant, I would have loved eat there. I've ate a couple of times for a while and I've grown really enjoy their Chicken Katsu and Loco Moco. The Mahi Mahi isn't half bad either, but it won't be filling me up anytime soon.

I usually get the Chicken Katsu because that's what seems to fill me up when I order here. The Loco Moco is good too, but only in flavor and not in filling one's hunger.

Most of their plate comes with the staple scoop of rice and macaroni. In my opinion, I love the macaroni but only with Sriracha sauce, salt, and pepper. I don't come here as often now since I tend to get tired of their food..
author: Richard C.

description:
There's not a lot of places on San Bruno Ave. that I consider go-to spots, but I've found a new reliable place: Hawaiian Drive Inn. When I didn't see the combination plate that I wanted (short ribs + chicken katsu), the cashier said, "No problem" and quickly rang me up.  

2 scoops of rice, a scoop of mac salad, 2 strips of bbq short ribs, and a generous portion of chicken katsu = $7.58 ($6.99 + tax). More than enough for myself and my co-worker to split and still have leftovers. 

I'll definitely come back when I'm craving meaty, fried, creamy mayo, rice goodness.
author: Monelle A.

description:
Unfortunately, this won't be a thorough review because I am a terrible Yelp-er and tend to get the same thing over and over again. This review is specifically for the Katsu Chicken and BBQ Chicken Special, along with other bits of odds and ends that I've come up with.

After my honeymoon to Hawaii, I've fallen in love with all things...well, Hawaiian. I know I'm idealizing the state and the people and the way of life. Not all Hawaiians spend their days surfing and eating shave ice. 

I digress.

Hawaiian Drive Inn is run by Chinese people. Don't let this throw you off. The portions are pretty gigantic and the prices are reasonable. My favorite is the Katsu Chicken and BBQ Chicken Special even though it's humongous because it's a great deal and it means I don't have to cook dinner! The katsu is not too fatty and the BBQ chicken is always super-tender, which I love.

The specials and mini plates come with rice and macaroni salad but I always ask for no macaroni salad and they always give me an extra scoop of rice.

The place is usually empty but business seems to be brisk. 

I like how the walls are sparsely decorated with slightly-Hawaiian things like a poster of a "typical" Tahitian and a Fijian (I think. My memory may betray me.). 

Back to the food. It's good stuff. It's filling. Get yourself some HDI.

P.S. It's cash only but there's a Bank of America a bit further north on San Bruno.
author: Christine P.

description:
The cheapest place for lunch on San Bruno. But does it worth your dough? haha, if you can sacrifice price for cheap food then yes!

Pretty clean and set up like a fast food restaurant. No wonder so many teenagers come here.
author: Michael Q.

description: This place has really good food and is also pretty cheap. The atmosphere is not great and the tables are a little sticky, but well worth it for the food. Getting the special was a smart move and one meal is basically a perfect quantity of food for one person.
author: Scott H.

description:
Bad service!

i normally dont care for service at ALL, as long as the food is good.. but this place realllllly sucked! 

n the food is mediocre, at best. :(

(ok, not like cardboard. hence the 2 stars.. lol)
author: Lisa N.

description: This place have change. The portion and the prices. The worst thing about this place is the people who work there. They use to be so friendly but today they prove to me that they don't care about the customer. I went in and order my usual item there and a Bento. While I was waiting for my order the staff have the nervous to talk about what I am ordering. I order my usual item and always order a certain way. The people in the kitchen was talking about how me in Chinese. They was talking if I couldn't understand them. I heard every single word. They were so disrespectful. I am NEVER coming back to this place. The staff spend more time gossiping than working. I also notice that sometimes the person behind the counter is spending more of their attention to their phone and gossiping with the people in the kitchen. I would NEVER give them any star if I could. I AM OFFICIALLY BOYCOTTING THIS PLACE. They have lost a customer today and I am more than happy to take my business to other places.
author: Chris Y.

description:
I recently started working in this hood and I've come here a few times already. They give a lot of food and the regular plate is two meals for me. 
It helps the wallet and the waistline!

Needless to say, If you're on a diet, then you probably shouldn't be eating plate lunch, but if you're game, this is some good grub bra!
author: Art O.

description: I usually get the BBQ Mixed Plate, which really fills me up. I've been trying to be careful with the portions I'm eating, so I ordered a Mini Katsu Plate. It was just right!! I didn't get uncomfortably stuffed, but was perfectly satisfied!! And of course it was yummy as always!!
author: Chachi M.

description: I like the chicken katsu not the wait. Once in awhile I will get it. It fills you up and their macaroni is YUMMY.! Got 8 dollars then you're GOOD TO Go
author: Victoria T.

description: If I'm ever in the area, I wouldn't hesitate to go to Hawaiian Drive Inn for some yummy Spam Musubi! My only gripe is that the restaurant is in a sketchy place, and I would know because I went to elementary school nearby. A couple of years ago, I watched a fellow customer get his phone stolen in broad daylight. Then again, it's not Hawaiian Drive Inn's fault, but at least get some security cameras installed so we can catch these thieves!
author: Joyce E.

description:
2.5 stars - only for their musubis.

My brother just got me spam musubi and chicken teriyaki musubi from here. Too much rice and not enough teriyaki sauce. 

Thin piece of spam + huge chunk of rice + little sauce = unsatisfying piece of dry musubi. =(

Perhaps their other plates would taste better.
author: Thomas Y.

description:
I honestly think this place surprise the heck out of me.
I was first very skeptical about a place full of kids and they don't even have real utensils(plates and forks)  Their food is served in a take out container.  I observed that they have a steady stream of customers and a lot of take outs.  Finally when I tried it, I was expecting small portions and super oily kids fast food.
I order one of the combination lunch plate and it has meat in there! The rice was cooked perfectly.  I have gone to another Hawaiian drive in at the mall and that was so gross.  Its like eating a  bottle of oil and the meat is tasteless. 
I got fill up and not too oily.  I do agree with the other review that its one of the better place to eat at San Bruno.  Its cheap and  good fast food.   Not much choices of vegi on the menu.  If you want healthy this is not for you.
author: Mar H.

description: You definitely get value for your money here, but we weren't impressed; cheap food, but if you're accustomed to the kick butt Hawaii food, it doesn't come close.We had the loco moco,and the kahlua pig, but wouldn't recommend here. But maybe we caught them on a bad night!
author: Giselle W.

description:
Affordable prices with decent portions. I usually go for the Chicken Katsu Mini-plate which keeps me full and doesn't break the bank. Service is average with only a bit of wait time. While their portions slightly decreased, and prices increased since my first time here about a year ago, this place is still good. 

I'd advise you to call in your order in advance as it can be a while waiting in-store.
author: Jacky P.

description:
This place rocks! I was never a fan of Hawaiian food probably because I was too timid to try it. Boy was I wrong. I went here after my boyfriend dragged me in telling me it wasn't Hawaiian food. I looked at the menu and decided to order the most American thing, the cheeseburger and fries. He got the garlic shrimp rice plate. The wait was a teeny bit long, since I expected this to be more of a fast food joint, but it really was only like 10-16 minutes. 

My plate:
The burger was hot hot hot off the grill, sooo yummy! and they gave me sooo many fries. It was like a small paper bag filled 2/3 of the way with fries. I think it was a large and they only charged a dollar something for it. 

His plate:
His plate looked so good I had to try it. We ended up swapping plates at the end cuz he kept eating my fries and I kept eating his shrimp. The shrimp were cooked in a delicious buttery garlic sauce with seasonings. It went perfect with the rice and the macaroni salad was bomb.

I am very very pleased with my experience here. The whole meal was $13.00 something for the both of us. Such a good deal for amazing food. I will definitely come back here!!!!
author: Emerald M.

description: Tasty and great portion size. Tastes just like Ono hawiian drive inn. They have fast service as well. Good customer service.
author: Ayana K.

description:
this review is for the chicken katsu!

excellent.. my order always comes fast, i love the weird macaroni salad that comes with it.. the cashier is always nice..
author: tiara E.

description: This place is a good value, lots of food for cheap, and it isn't half bad either. I don't want to harp on them as the counter people are usually friendly and seem to put up with some tough customers, but I am sorry to say though that the last time I was here two cockroaches ran across the floor, staff didn't seem fazed at all, may have questionable sanitation.
author: Dan M.

description: Their rude except for one of the guys who work there and they messed up my order and they always talk shit , the food is super oily n greasy and they take forever to make ur order
author: Allison K.

description:
This Hawaiian Drive Inn is one of the best in my opinion. Why? Because they provide HUGE tasty portions. The bf and I both each ordered a miniplate and i swear it was like the size of a regular meal. They've got a good amount of tables for seating. 

Definitely a place to get the bang for your buck!
author: M W.

description: Been coming here since my middle school days. It has gotten better over the years. During the school year especially after the middle school near by comes out, it's pretty busy and noisy with a bunch of middle schoolers. Staff is friendly, prices are great for what you get.
author: Samantha H.

description: This place serves Hawaiian fast food.  The restaurant looks clean and  brightly lit.  Unlike other Hawaiian restaurants, this is not a hole in the wall.  Menu selection was very typical.  Loco Moco, Katsu, fried seafood, spam musubi, and canned Hawaiian drinks.  Servings are very generous.  The servings for the mini plate items are also very generous.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  I tried the Loco Moco.  It was really good.  The macaroni salad was rich and creamy.  It was not bland.  The hamburger patty was cooked properly and full of meaty flavor.  The fried eggs were fine,  not over cooked.  The prices were very reasonable given the huge portions they served.  Spam musubi was OK.   I will go to this place again, if I am hungry and want to load up on cheap food.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: Mini chicken katsu is all you need. Don't let the name fool you, its a full meal! I order it with two deep fried prawns, and I'm set. If you are feeling really hungry, a full chicken katsu plate is about $6 and it will leave you set all night.
author: FILL S.

description: I found the original owners!!! Yay! Now I can enjoy close to Hawaiian food here on the main island. The food even taste the same when there were back at their Daly City location. However, nothing can replace actual Hawaiian food but this place comes pretty darn close!
author: Maile W.

description: Chicken was dry, rice was dry, beef was overcook, musubi rice was dry. Too much rice little meat... Will never go back, period.
author: Y Y.

description: LOCO MOCO! is the only thing I get now. Use to come here so often back in the high school days so I got tired of mostly everything on the menu except loco moco. Prices are fair. Very bright interior. Food is decent. Another one of those places where you can go and just chill or take out. Nothing special, just the variety and consistency.
author: Hui L.

description:
There's this friendly yellow-walled establishment, run by friendly men, and next to the friendly cash register is a lovely, friendly sign that screams "CASH ONLY, you bettah nowt THINK about trying to charge it, I want to see the green"  Well, it only says "CASH ONLY" but you get the picture.  

Tori got a chicken katsu mini-plate with two scoops of rice and no macaroni salad (yes, I think she's a little nutty sometimes too), one for her leetle seester.

Lou got a chicken katsu mini plate, the regular, no-frills, not-nitpicky way.  And he ate it all.

I got the beef short ribs for myself and the chicken katsu for the BF who was driving up from Campbell at 9pm.  It had been a marathon study session, 10 hours practically.  I was fried.  In the brain.  This is your brain.  This is my brain in law school.  No questions at this time, your honor.  

The beef short ribs were kind of fatty.  But that's like saying carrots are rather orange.  It's intrinsic to ribs that they have fat on them.  Yes?  The taste was decent.  The marinade was a little too sweet and the meat just a little too tender.  Tori's dogs enjoyed the bones and watching them wait for the tid-bits was the best part of the meal.  

The chicken katsu here was much thinner than I'd expected.  Did they butterfly the butterflied meat?  Like turn it in to 1/4 the thickness?  Standard panko breading, standard dipping sauce.

Mayo salad, I mean macaroni salad was good.  I nearly licked the plate.  It had me itching for more lately.  Mayo-mayo-mayo.  The white devil can be rather tasty at times.  

The spam musubi here was cheaper than the other Hawaiian places, by 20 cents.  I have not yet tried.  It is so close to Tori's place that I'm sure I will eat here again.  And then, maybe it'll wow me. 

The thing that did wow me was the price.  The two mini-plates I got were less than $10 total.  Excellent.  Cheap.  Just as broke ass student like it.  Broke and cheap.
author: Christina C.

description:
Love the Party Paks.  Call in the morning and pick it up for dinner.  Good eats, and they always throw in a little something extra for me because I order so much.

Chicken Katsu and Chicken Teriyaki are my personal favorites, but don't catch yourself eating them every day because you're liable to turn into a pile of fried goo.
author: Michael A.

description: I still come here for those days I crave masubi or chicken katsu. For the past two years or so, I've noticed their quality and service declining. Prices went up which sucks but I'd pick this place over any other Hawaiian places in the city.
author: Nancy T.

description:
I work nearby (in HP) in a telecom facility, and I've eaten at most of the restraunts on San Bruno ave. This place is by far one of the cleanest, and the staff are pretty friendly. One of the regular plates is enough of a meal for me, and you can't beat the price.

The food is fairly consistent in preparation and flavor, so its a good place for a quick bite.
author: Tom S.

description: This place is the original Hawaiian Drive Inn of SF.  The owners Alan and Maggie opened the first Hawaiian Drive Inn during the mid 90's on Mission Street, even before an L&L opened in the Bay Area. Since then they have opened quite a few through out the Bay Area, settling down here on San Bruno Ave.  My favorite is the Katsu Hamburger Steak combo.  If you're in the area, stop in and enjoy!
author: Eric D.

description:
cant beat katsu and bbq teriyaki chicken and short ribs...my baby loves that chicken...on "i dont want to cook tonight" nights...they come thru every time...

i took 2 points away cuz the service is bad and the food is bad for you...plus they charge 1 dolar per re-fill of soda...
author: Bane V.

description: I love the spam musubi! Spam is just so addicting, ive been eating spam and rice for the last couple weeks and never got tired of it... Other than that thenpeople here are really nice and it makes me always wanna come back:)
author: Jessica C.

description:
A benevolent co-worker, upon hearing that I'm from Hawaii, drove me out to this place.  I appreciated her thoughtfulness, she said it was a "great place."   Note: she has never been to Hawaii...

I've only been here twice, and on both occasions have NOT been impressed.  

I'd go here if I felt homesick, but the food is far from authentic Hawaii plate lunch.  For those of you who are not familiar with "real" Hawaiian plate lunch, do not let this place be your model.

Is this place good?  It's OK.
Is it somewhere to go out of your way to go to? No.
author: Penny P.

description:
The only thing I order here is the potstickers..
A lovely portion of huge pot stickers with a delicious dark sauce with chopped green onions in it.

YUMMY.
author: Lorraine L.

description: One of the better places to eat at on San Bruno Ave, which really is not saying much. I ordered the Combination BBQ Plate hoping to experience a little bit of everything. Both the BBQ and the short ribs were bland and tasteless. It was as if they forgot to marinate. The dining room is very clean in comparison to some of the other restaurants on San Bruno Ave. Given a choice, I'd rather go to L&L instead.
author: Willk W.

description:
This is mainly for the spam masubi and the BBQ plate. 

The spam masubi doesn't taste as good as other places I have tried, in fact it tastes kind of bland.

The BBQ plate also tastes kind of bland, iono maybe it's just me and I like to compare this place to L&L. L&L still has the best masubi!
author: Natalie G.

description: i love love love this place since i was in middle school. it was the hang out spot for middle schoolers, high schoolers,&teachers after school. It's also very cheap. everything is fresh off the grill as well. They also have American things. Such as cheese burger and fries. Pretty good but not as good as Mcds. It's a great place to grab a fast lunch every now and then.
author: Nart T.

description: I had the BBQ mixed plate and thought the chicken was great, but wasn't too impressed with their beef. Their portion size is quite good and the prices are very reasonable. They have a variety of dishes ranging from chicken katsu to hamburgers. They also have something called spam musubi, which I'm looking forward to trying the next time I come here.
author: Derek L.

description:
i usually order the "standard" bbq chicken. So far it taste the best at this location. Most hawaiian drive inn's are family owned and run but this location is different They hire outside help, "see-see", and it taste the best so far. Parking is a pain around this area, even worse during 49ers games, they park in the area. But still worth the try.

CASH ONLY, they do not accept credit cards.
author: Robin L.

description:
Lotta Food and Hella Cheap

I grind here all the time...short ribs, bbq chicken and kaluha pork mmmm.........loco moco...longanisa & eggs...dont forget spam (you know you like it).....saimen too

I know its not  like Hawaii but are french fries like France???

Call ahead to pick up in 10 minutes, get trays for parties, parkig is hit and miss
author: Scotty B.

description:
I couldn't believe my eyes when I saw bad reviews for this Hawaiian Drive In.  This is fast food Hawaiian BBQ and it is delicious everytime.  The favorites are Loco Moco (over easy eggs, seasoned meat patties over sticky rice and gravy with mac salad) and BBQ mixed plate (short ribs, my personal favorite, chicken, beef over rice and mac).  These meals are big (2 people filling) and consistantly good.  I've tried some of the other hawaiian bbq and drive in spots and they have been much worse!!!  Especially the one in Tanforan mall!  Never again.  This is THE spot, f* whatever the other folks say.
And it does NOT accept credit or debit cards, bring your cash, stop at one of the local ATMS or buy a drink and get cash back from Walgreens down the block.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Hawaiian Drive in is pretty good if you're really hungry. Gigantic portions at a reasonable price. 

Do not get the Spam musubi here (and reason for the 2 stars), it's cheap but they don't put any sauce on it. Just spam, rice, and seaweed. DISGUSTING
author: Danny K.

description: i dislike hawaiian food i don't like it in california and i didn't like it when i traveled to hawaii last year.. after eating at this restaurant i got so sick with food poisoning and barf all the way back home to concord missed out on my rehab program and bed ridden for  4 days...... never again will i eat at here.....
author: Jessica P.

description:
this place has always come through to solve my problem of hunger. huge portions of delicious hawaiian bbq always seem to brighten my day. this place comes through the same way the other locations do. they all have the same menu and very similar service. my loyalties do belong to the location in the excelsior but this place has come through for me many a time. i generally get the bbq mixplate with rice and macaroni salad. its never done me wrong. the prices too are always easy on the wallet. especially considering the portions. more often than not i can save a little bit for later. this place is what i would consider oner of the staples of the san bruno avenue food experience. i most likely wouldn't place it higher than johnsons bbq or the fat belly deli but close. 

basically if you're in the area and craving cheap/large portions and arent of the vegetarian nature, then for damn sure stop by the HDI. parking can sometimes be a pain in the ass, but if you look long enough, you'll find a spot on san bruno, just bring some quarters and you'll be fine.
author: Andrew D.

description:
This place is pretty good.. I liek their small plate of bbq chicken for $4.60

thats not a bad price for soo much chicken.... it had enough flavor, it was tender, it was crisp, it was juicy it was how i like my chicken!!! :D

-x3 shells
author: Lily X.

description: The sriracha condiment at this establishment is like a gift from... well... Who other than I, the Lord Jesus Raptor Christ!!! Kneel B4 me and ask for forgiveness!
author: Raptor Jesus C.

description: I used to come to this place almost everyday for a month to get food with my boyfriend!! The food here is really good and the people working here are pretty friendly! This place actually has quite a few tables too..yay somewhere to sit! lol!
author: Heather C.

description:
ok so the pit master down the street at johnsons bbq is chinese, the owners of this hawaiian joint are chinese and the cooks are messicans, hard knox is an asian owned sEoul joint.

you gotta love san francisco. 

the food is pretty damn decent. this part of town, you dont gots too many choices. clean, fast, good food. 

my heart may not go on after too many meals here, but thats what dancing the night away is for.
author: Euge L.

description: As I waited for my order of bbq chicken-all rice last week, the health inspector was there doing his inspection. They got a score of 100. This Hawaiian Drive inn #28 is comparable to the one in the Outer Sunset on Noriega. I see one of the chefs at both places.
author: Kevo M.

description: i love the chicken katsu! i usually get one piece. when it first opened within the first year, one piece was a lot!! but now it's a lot less :/
author: Bailey L.

description: Mac is kind of nasty! It gave me a MAJOR headache because there was way too much mayo in it! After Hawaiian Drive Inn, I never ate Marconi Salad again. The other food was good, but the Marconi salad was nasty!
author: Janet Z.

description: Good food, cheap too. No frills, but one if the better ones in the city.
author: Jm C.

description: If you want to eat meat, I said to my 20 year old weight lifting brother, this is the place to go.  Brocoli is the only vegetable they serve.
author: Holly B.

description: I like going to this place because they serve pretty fast and the portions are huge, so you get good bang for your buck.  Only accept cash, though, but ifor about 6 or 7 bucks, you get a pretty decent meal, but I think the food isn't that good for you cause you only see fat people eating here.
author: James C.

description:
If you're on San Bruno Ave. this place is in the top 3.  The portions are huge and the prices are great!  No other reviews here mention the pot stickers.  Oh, they are sooo good.  The dipping sauce that comes with this is like no other.  Spicey with jalapenos!  

This place is in the top 3 for me because it is clean, has friendly service, and great food!  I always get the BBQ chicken and broccoli plate and don't forget the pot stickers!

The only negative is that they only accept cash!  Save the wait time and call ahead with your order.  

(Hamburgers aren't so good; stick with the hawaiian BBQ.)
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
This place is horrible. Go to ONO HAWAIIAN BBQ!!! there's one by serramonte mall and there's one on Sloat Blvd.

I can taste and smell the oil in the food. Last time I got take out for work, I didn't think I would have to check the food. I was craving hawaiian BBQ for a while, especially the bbq sauce they give you, for some reason when I got to work instead of BBQ sauce, it's GRAVY. Sorry I'm not that much of a gravy fan so that just ruined my whole lunch appetite. Honestly...6.50 went into the trash and all I actually ate was the macaroni salad. What a waste of money. if I knew any sooner, I would've turned my car around before I got to work. Forget my business at this place.

ONO HAWAIIAN BBQ FOR LIFE!
author: Miss D.

description: this would be my local hawaiian drive inn since i live nearby. their food isn't bad at all. they actually taste about the same as l&l. i usually stop by after work because they close at 9 and it's a stop before home so i don't have to cook. they should accept credit card because l&l does. this place is cash only so if you're deciding to come here, make sure you have cash!
author: Valerie N.

description: Ain't nothing wrong with this place. Perfect for the worktime lunch pickup. I phone in my order all the time and have it waiting for me when I get there. Gotta go with the mini-plates of katsu or loco moco. The preferred dish however, is the Portuguese sausage and (scrambled) eggs. Good price, good taste, and just plain good eats.  Beats out the Sunset one by far. On par with the other ones.
author: Erick K.

description: I was in the mood for Hawaiian bbq...I decided to drive to a spot instead of ordering waiters on wheels, so off to Hawaiian Drive Inn we went.  We ordered the chicken katsu curry and garlic shrimp plates.  Portions are huge, prices are cheap.  Food is good...although I personally like a saucy thick curry sauce and what they offered here, to me, was a little thin.  My one little complaint was  that this place was FREEZING.  No heat. Yikes.  Aside, from that, the staff  was nice, they brought our food to our table with a smile.  Even though only 3 stars, I may give them another chance
author: Jessica G.
